intro: Arctophila fulva, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Arctophila fulva is adapted to withstand drought and has a low-growing, sprawling habit.
